etymologies: late 17th century: abbreviation of pohickery, the local Virginian name, from Algonquian pawcohiccora

definitions: a chiefly North American tree of the walnut family that yields useful timber and typically bears edible nuts.

notes.text: Genus Carya, family Juglandaceae: several species, including the shagbark hickory (C. ovata), with shaggy peeling bark. See also pecan, pignut

shortDefinitions: chiefly North American tree of walnut family that yields useful timber bears edible nuts

definitions: a stick made of hickory wood.
